Key Match Events: Los Angeles forced Minnesota into 16 turnovers, scoring 19 points on those changes of possession.
The Lakers dominated inside the paint with a 72-40 advantage.
Anthony Davis had Defensive Player of the Year caliber blocks.
L.A. took control early in the second quarter, going on a 21-6 run.
Despite shooting 5-30 from 3-point range, the Lakers were able to crash the glass and prevent the Timberwolves from scoring.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis praised the team's elite defensive game plan and execution.
Davis highlighted the team's effort and energy in maintaining their defensive performance for 48 minutes.
Rui Hachimura emphasized the team's defensive focus, particularly on Anthony Edwards.
JJ Redick, in his first game as an NBA coach, praised the team's execution of the defensive game plan.
